attributes.action: Making exclusions transparent for black boys
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Department for Children, Families and Schools (DCSF) previously known as the Department for Education and Skills published a Priority Review report called “Getting it, Getting it right, in 2006.

The report outlined actions the DCSF would take to close the exclusions gap for black children. This included  support from National Strategies in the top 100 schools that disproportionately exclude black pupils.  

However Baroness Morgan Parliamentary Under-Secretary for the DCSF during her speech at the London Schools and Black Child Conference (7th February 2009)revealed that the schools the National Strategies had supported were randomly chosen and not targeted.  

Given the risks black boys face in the education system, parents/carers have a right to know which schools are more likely to discriminate against their children.  

Therefore this petition is to lobby the DCSF to nationally publish the names of the 100 schools that were originally going to be targeted.
